verses.verse: The LORD will (Deut. 28:8) command His lovingkindness in the daytime, And (Job 35:10; Ps. 149:5) in the night His song shall be with me— A prayer to the God of my life.
I will say to God my Rock, (Ps. 38:6) “Why have You forgotten me? Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?”
As with a breaking of my bones, My enemies reproach me, (Ps. 42:3; Joel 2:17; Mic. 7:10) While they say to me all day long, “Where is your God?”
(Ps. 43:5) Why are you cast down, O my soul? And why are you disquieted within me? Hope in God; For I shall yet praise Him, The help of my countenance and my God.
Prayer to God in Time of Trouble Vindicate ((Ps. 26:1; 35:24)) me, O God, And (1 Sam. 24:15; Ps. 35:1) plead my cause against an ungodly nation; Oh, deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man!
For You are the God of my strength; Why do You cast me off? (Ps. 42:9) Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
((Ps. 40:11)) Oh, send out Your light and Your truth! Let them lead me; Let them bring me to (Ps. 3:4) Your holy hill And to Your tabernacle.
Then I will go to the altar of God, To God my exceeding joy; And on the harp I will praise You, O God, my God.
(Ps. 42:5, 11) Why are you cast down, O my soul? And why are you disquieted within me? Hope in God; For I shall yet praise Him, The help of my countenance and my God.

Redemption Remembered in Present Dishonor To the Chief Musician. A (Ps. 42:title) Contemplation of the sons of Korah. [1] We have heard with our ears, O God, ((Ex. 12:26, 27; Deut. 6:20); Judg. 6:13; Ps. 78:3) Our fathers have told us, The deeds You did in their days, In days of old:
(Ex. 15:17; 2 Sam. 7:10; Jer. 24:6; Amos 9:15) You drove out the nations with Your hand, But them You planted; You afflicted the peoples, and cast them out.

For ((Deut. 8:17, 18); Josh. 24:12) they did not gain possession of the land by their own sword, Nor did their own arm save them; But it was Your right hand, Your arm, and the light of Your countenance, ((Deut. 4:37; 7:7, 8)) Because You favored them.
((Ps. 74:12)) You are my King, O God; Command victories for Jacob.
Through You (Deut. 33:17; (Dan. 8:4)) we will push down our enemies; Through Your name we will trample those who rise up against us.
For ((1 Sam. 17:47); Ps. 33:16; (Hos. 1:7)) I will not trust in my bow, Nor shall my sword save me.
But You have saved us from our enemies, And have put to shame those who hated us.
(Ps. 34:2; (Jer. 9:24)) In God we boast all day long, And praise Your name forever. Selah
But (Ps. 60:1) You have cast us off and put us to shame, And You do not go out with our armies.
You make us (Lev. 26:17; Josh. 7:8, 12; Ps. 89:43) turn back from the enemy, And those who hate us have taken spoil for themselves.
(Ps. 44:22; Rom. 8:36) You have given us up like sheep intended for food, And have (Lev. 26:33; Deut. 4:27; 28:64; Ps. 106:27; Ezek. 20:23) scattered us among the nations.
(Is. 52:3, 4; Jer. 15:13) You sell Your people for next to nothing, And are not enriched by selling them.
(Ps. 79:4; 80:6; Jer. 24:9) You make us a reproach to our neighbors, A scorn and a derision to those all around us.
(Deut. 28:37) You make us a byword among the nations, (Job 16:4) A shaking of the head among the peoples.
My dishonor is continually before me, And the shame of my face has covered me,
Because of the voice of him who reproaches and reviles, (Ps. 8:2) Because of the enemy and the avenger.
(Dan. 9:13) All this has come upon us; But we have not forgotten You, Nor have we dealt falsely with Your covenant.
